data.title: Work at the YMCA
data.meta_description: Change the lives of others and make a difference in your community today by working at the Y. Explore open jobs and career opportunities at the Y.
data.text:
Whether you’re interested in joining us as a preschool teacher, lifeguard, fitness trainer, swim instructor, or membership specialist, at the Y, you’ll join a team that shares your passion for making an impact––and develop valuable new skills along the way.

With her background in accounting, Ashley knows that she has a lot of job options. She finds her job as Controller at YMCA of Northern Utah especially fulfilling because her accounting skills help advance an organization that “helps people grow.” This is her Y career. Her camera. Her story.

As a graphic artist for the Tampa Metropolitan Area YMCA, Jim uses his artistic talents to create vibrant digital and print assets to promote his Y. Jim also helped launch the LGBTQIA+ Employee Resource Group (ERG) and is proud to make his Y a place where everyone can feel that they belong.

This is his Y career. His camera. His story.

Anand is proud of his 18-year career as an HR professional at the South Shore YMCA. His work goes well beyond HR though. From collecting gifts for kids, to riding in a bike race to raise money for his Y, to promoting diversity and inclusion initiatives, Anand is the first to step up to volunteer beyond his role.

This is his Y Career. His Camera. His Story.

As Senior Aquatics Director at the Hamilton Area YMCA, Nicole is able to shape life-saving and life-enhancing aquatics programming. Her team loves that they can count on her to encourage them and create a sense of family, and her community loves that she consistently innovates to improve water safety and the aquatics experience.

This is her Y Career. Her Camera. Her Story.

As Vice President of Corporate and Civic Engagement at The Y in Central Maryland, Eric works with partner organizations, colleagues and volunteers to meet the most urgent needs of the community that his Y serves. See why Eric's colleagues view him as a cornerstone in the community.

This is his Y career. His camera. His story.
